posts.post_content:
"So I herd u liek Bloodghast..."  
  
It's almost like WOTC's development team is always looking for ways to improve [Nether Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nether Shadow).  
  
"Hey guys, remember Nether Shadow?"  
"Yeah, that was good in its day. Impossible to use now, though."  
"Well, I have an idea. Here's [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast)!"  
"Sick, dude. Hey, here's [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler)!"  
"I'll raise you a Strangleroot Geist!"

Posted By: ThinkOriginal (9/26/2012 12:09:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is an excellent creature, with a low mana cost that definitely represents the card. It's highly competitive and has been a 4-of in any deck with green since it was available in standard. It's cheap enough to make the rounds at kitchen tables, but powerful enouh to draw lots of oohs and aahs. Because it uses a set specific keyword, we won't likely see a reprint soon, unless it ends up in a duel deck, planechase expansion, or EDH add-on. This means that if it finds it's way consistently into any Legacy or Modern decks, it'll probably shoot up to $4 or $5, ala Cursecatcher. This card defines the curve. 5/5.
posts.html:

Because it uses a set specific keyword, we won't likely see a reprint soon, unless it ends up in a duel deck, planechase expansion, or EDH add-on. This means that if it finds it's way consistently into any Legacy or Modern decks, it'll probably shoot up to $4 or $5, ala Cursecatcher. This card defines the curve. 5/5.

Posted By: vantha (6/13/2012 2:57:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Okuu-Chan  
No. [Nether Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nether Shadow) is still pretty much king. [Nether Traitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nether Traitor) and [Ichorid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichorid) are also great. The ones you cited are either:  
-Not free  
-Require something to happen  
-Don't have haste  
-Can't block  
-Can't get out T2 without casting them  
  
I.E. [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) can come out T2 with shinanigans (T1 if you have some temp ramp) but there's almost no point! Just cast him. [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler) requires a zombie and still has to be cast. This guy isn't black, only comes back once, may not come back, and certainly doesn't do it for free.  
  
I defy you to build an Ichorid/[Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return)/[Cabal Therapy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Therapy) style deck using a card like this JUST because it has undying. In a deck like mine (not manaless ichorid, but plays somewhat like it) I can:  
Swamp, [Putrid Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Imp), ditch [Stinkweed Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stinkweed Imp) (or similar), cycle [Street Wraith/auto](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith/auto)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Okuu-Chan
No. Nether Shadow is still pretty much king. Nether Traitor and Ichorid are also great. The ones you cited are either:
-Not free
-Require something to happen
-Don't have haste
-Can't block
-Can't get out T2 without casting them

I.E. Bloodghast can come out T2 with shinanigans (T1 if you have some temp ramp) but there's almost no point! Just cast him. Gravecrawler requires a zombie and still has to be cast. This guy isn't black, only comes back once, may not come back, and certainly doesn't do it for free.

I defy you to build an Ichorid/Dread Return/Cabal Therapy style deck using a card like this JUST because it has undying. In a deck like mine (not manaless ichorid, but plays somewhat like it) I can:
Swamp, Putrid Imp, ditch Stinkweed Imp (or similar), cycle Street Wraith/auto... (see all)
